final_answer.explanation: The driver who finished 6th in the qualifying round of the 2004 Malaysian Grand Prix is Kimi Räikkönen. During the 2004 season, he drove for McLaren - Mercedes. As of 2021, Kimi Räikkönen was driving for Alfa Romeo Racing in Formula One, marking the end of his career after the 2021 season. His career has included significant achievements such as winning the Formula One World Championship in 2007 while with Ferrari and being known for his laid-back personality and impressive driving skills.

graph.title: Identify 6th Place Driver
graph.content: <35>[Identify 6th Place Driver] Identify the driver who finished 6th in the qualifying round of the 2004 Malaysian Grand Prix from the provided data.</35>
graph.answer:
Jenson Button is a British racing driver known for his successful career in Formula One and beyond. He began karting at the age of eight and progressed through various racing series, including the British Formula Ford Championship and the British Formula 3 Championship. Button made his Formula One debut with Williams in 2000, but his breakthrough came when he joined BAR (British American Racing) in 2003, where he achieved significant success.

In 2004, he finished third in the World Drivers' Championship, showcasing his talent and competitiveness. The team was later rebranded as Honda Racing F1 Team, and in 2006, Button won his first Grand Prix at the Hungarian GP after 113 races. His most significant achievement came in 2009 when he won the Formula One World Championship driving for Brawn GP, a team that emerged from Honda's withdrawal from the sport. He won six of the first seven races that season, securing the championship at the Brazilian Grand Prix.

After his successful stint in Formula One, Button transitioned to other racing series. He currently competes in the Japanese Super GT Series, driving a Honda NSX-GT for Team Kunimitsu, where he won the championship in 2018. Throughout his career, Button has been known for his skill, consistency, and sportsmanship, making him one of the respected figures in motorsport.

graph.answer: The driver who finished 6th in the qualifying round of the 2004 Malaysian Grand Prix is Kimi Räikkönen, who drove for McLaren - Mercedes during that season. Kimi Räikkönen is a Finnish racing driver known for his successful career in Formula One. He made his debut in 2001 with Sauber and has since driven for several teams, including McLaren, Ferrari, and Alfa Romeo Racing. Notably, he won the Formula One World Championship in 2007 while driving for Ferrari. As of 2021, Kimi Räikkönen was driving for Alfa Romeo Racing in Formula One, marking the end of his career after the 2021 season. His career is distinguished by his laid-back personality, impressive driving skills, and a total of 21 Grand Prix victories, making him one of the most successful Finnish drivers in the sport's history.

graph.title: Summarize Driver's Career
graph.content: <37>[Summarize Driver's Career] Compile a summary of the driver's career, focusing on their history with different teams and any notable achievements.</37>
graph.answer: To compile a comprehensive career timeline for Kimi Räikkönen, we will consolidate his team history and notable achievements based on the gathered information. Kimi Räikkönen, born on October 17, 1979, began his Formula One career with Sauber-Petronas in 2001. He then moved to McLaren-Mercedes in 2002, where he became a title contender, finishing as runner-up in the championship in 2003 and 2005. After a series of seasons marked by car unreliability, he transitioned to Scuderia Ferrari in 2007, where he won the Formula One World Championship in his first season with the team. Räikkönen continued with Ferrari until 2009, achieving significant success, including multiple race wins and podium finishes. After a brief hiatus from Formula One to compete in the World Rally Championship in 2010 and 2011, he returned to the sport in 2012 with Lotus, where he secured two more victories and finished third in the championship in 2012. In 2014, he returned to Ferrari for a second stint before moving to Alfa Romeo Racing in 2019, where he currently competes. The timeline will highlight key milestones such as his championship win in 2007, his notable race victories, and his transitions between teams.
